summary: Medicare spent $6.7 billion on durable medical equipment (generally, equipment that lasts at least 3 years) in 2015. Companies have developed disposable versions of some of these medical devices, such as insulin pumps, that could act as potential substitutes. We found that some of these disposable devices could potentially save money or result in better health outcomes compared to the durable versions in some cases...
title: Medicare: CMS Should Evaluate Providing Coverage for Disposable Medical Devices That Could Substitute for Durable Medical Equipment
